availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p: I James F Bond residing in the City Newark County of Essex and State of New Jersey, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky to take the proof and aclmpw;edg,emt of deeds, and other writings and to administer oaths, do Solemnly swear that I will well & faithfully Execute and perform, all the duties of such Commission under and by virtue of the laws of Kentucky.
Subscribed & sworn before me this ^Eighth,^ Third day of April in the year one thousand Eight hundred and Sixty one, at Newark aforesaid, George F. Tuttle Master in Chancery of N.J.
I herewith send you an impression of the seal I shall use in the execution of any papers by me, also my signature

figure.ab:
JAMES F. BOND
COMMISSIONER
FOR
THE STATE OF
Kentucky
NEWARK ESSEX COUNTY NEW JERSEY

body.p:
New. Jersey
Oath
Jas F. Bond
Comr of Deeds
